channel.title: Veriables and all java stuff
channel.description:
I know a bit about Java like what are veriables ( integers and these things that store data ) but I always get stuck in tuts because of some stuff:
1) What are those stuff I see like public int void and where are they should be? 2) The main server class is mostly client.java right? 3) Can some 1 rexplain to me how I add iPanel V2 to my server? link: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,370872.0.html , I got really messed up with the instructions , please explain EXCACLY where to put each line and how to add it perfectly. 4) What is SYIpkpker? 5) What that means : First, open up client.java, add this near any public void's ? what is a public void and where can I find one in the client.java?
That's all for now , hope to understand quickly.
Thanks alot , Danny :)

item.title: Veriables and all java stuff
item.dc:creator: @Goodbye_RS_Hello_RSP Goodbye RS, Hello RSPS
item.description:
@Goodbye_RS_Hello_RSP wrote:

[quote=“pk3r john, post:3, topic:318924”][code]1. I thought you just said you know what integers are…
2. Yes, but some higher level servers that are packaged this does not apply to
3. Follow the tutorial
4. A crasher, dw about it now, used to be dangerous but now it only works on the really outdated or non-stable servers
5. It doesn’t matter where you add methods. DO NOT CALL THEM VOIDS. THEY ARE METHODS. And a “public void” declares something. I.E, you wanted to add a frame75 or something, you would do like:

public void frame75
(insert code here)

And to find one… just CTRL+F and search “public void”[/code]

Also, here are some really good RSPS programmers:

SWAT (Client work)
Zee Best
Lin
Davidi2 is pretty good in 508+ deob stuff, knows alot about real java (like apps and shit)[/quote]

Lol.

Me > SWAT, Davidi2

Read full topic

item.title: Veriables and all java stuff
item.dc:creator: @Red_Tapuah Red Tapuah
item.description:
@Red_Tapuah wrote:

I think I finally got it.

I will try to do this again hopfully I will succeed , thanks everyone!

Read full topic

item.title: Veriables and all java stuff
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

1: They are public variables which means that they can be accessed from any class, not just the class that they are delcared in.
2: Yes.
3: No.
4: SYIpkpker is a program which connects to your server loads of times and forces it to crash. It’s prevention is a priority amongst server owners.
5: A “public void” is a method whos scope is public and does not return a value. It doesn’t really matter where you add it, as long as it is inside the class and not inside another method.

Someone will probably post before me, but I can’t help that because I am moderated.

Read full topic

item.title: Veriables and all java stuff
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:8, topic:318924”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=415379.msg3057102#msg3057102 date=1260572366]

I know a bit about Java like what are veriables ( integers and these things that store data ) but I always get stuck in tuts because of some stuff:

  1. What are those stuff I see like public int void and where are they should be?
  2. The main server class is mostly client.java right?
  3. Can some 1 rexplain to me how I add iPanel V2 to my server? link: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,370872.0.html , I got really messed up with the instructions , please explain EXCACLY where to put each line and how to add it perfectly.
  4. What is SYIpkpker?
  5. What that means : First, open up client.java, add this near any public void’s ? what is a public void and where can I find one in the client.java?

That’s all for now , hope to understand quickly.

Thanks alot , Danny

First of all, they’re called ‘variables’, not ‘veriables’.

  1. Ints, booleans, bytes, voids, etc are primitive data types, which stores data, whether numerical or true/false conditions.
    [/quote]

…

The return type ‘void’ isn’t a primitive data type…and it depends on what you’re using to store the data. If the method’s return type is String, it will return a String. For example…:

public String test() { return "test"; }[/quote]
Yah, everyone makes careless mistakes in their posts in a while.

Read full topic

item.title: Veriables and all java stuff
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

  1. You can read about the aforementioned methods in The Java™ Tutorials.

  2. In the majority of servers, yes, the main client is the main class.

  3. I suggest you erase your progress and repeat the tutorial, carefully following it this time.

  4. SYIpkpker is an old bot used to crash servers.

  5. That means you must open your client class, and add a method.

I really don’t think we need to be any more specific than that.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:7, topic:318924”][quote author=Red Tapuah link=topic=415379.msg3056952#msg3056952 date=1260564472]
I know a bit about Java like what are veriables ( integers and these things that store data ) but I always get stuck in tuts because of some stuff:

  1. What are those stuff I see like public int void and where are they should be?
  2. The main server class is mostly client.java right?
  3. Can some 1 rexplain to me how I add iPanel V2 to my server? link: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,370872.0.html , I got really messed up with the instructions , please explain EXCACLY where to put each line and how to add it perfectly.
  4. What is SYIpkpker?
  5. What that means : First, open up client.java, add this near any public void’s ? what is a public void and where can I find one in the client.java?

That’s all for now , hope to understand quickly.

Thanks alot , Danny

[/quote]
First of all, they’re called ‘variables’, not ‘veriables’.

  1. Ints, booleans, bytes, voids, etc are primitive data types, which stores data, whether numerical or true/false conditions.[/quote]

…

The return type ‘void’ isn’t a primitive data type…and it depends on what you’re using to store the data. If the method’s return type is String, it will return a String. For example…:

public String test() { return "test"; }

Read full topic

item.title: Veriables and all java stuff
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Red Tapuah, post:1, topic:318924”]I know a bit about Java like what are veriables ( integers and these things that store data ) but I always get stuck in tuts because of some stuff:

  1. What are those stuff I see like public int void and where are they should be?
  2. The main server class is mostly client.java right?
  3. Can some 1 rexplain to me how I add iPanel V2 to my server? link: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,370872.0.html , I got really messed up with the instructions , please explain EXCACLY where to put each line and how to add it perfectly.
  4. What is SYIpkpker?
  5. What that means : First, open up client.java, add this near any public void’s ? what is a public void and where can I find one in the client.java?

That’s all for now , hope to understand quickly.

Thanks alot , Danny :)[/quote]
First of all, they’re called ‘variables’, not ‘veriables’.

  1. Ints, booleans, bytes, voids, etc are primitive data types, which stores data, whether numerical or true/false conditions.

  2. The main server class? I think you mean the ‘main class’ or the ‘server class’. The main class on most sources is the client class.

  3. That tutorial isn’t too hard to follow. Try reading it more carefully.

  4. SYIPkPker is a program that attempts to flood it’s victim (your server) with many connections, causing it to crash, etc.

  5. The client.java is the client class. The ‘public voids’ are methods and declarations of variables that are called later on.

Read full topic

Thanks anyway!
